question: What is the Parent Company of Google?
hints: It is mostly a collection of companies. The largest of which, is Google
Through a corporate restructuring of Google on October 2, 2015, it became the parent company of Google
Name means means a collection of letters that represent language
aboutAnswer:
Alphabet Inc. is an American multinational conglomerate headquartered in Mountain View, California. It was created through a corporate restructuring of Google on October 2, 2015, and became the parent company of Google and several former Google subsidiaries.
Alphabet is mostly a collection of companies. The largest of which, of course, is Google. This newer Google is a bit slimmed down, with the companies that are pretty far afield of our main internet products contained in Alphabet instead.
Alphabet's largest subsidiary is Google. Its other subsidiaries include Calico, Chronicle, DeepMind, GV, CapitalG, X, Google Fiber, Jigsaw, Makani, Sidewalk Labs, Verily, Waymo, Wing and Loon.
